instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Are Are 820-2877-B and 820-2361-A compatible? and 820-2361-A compatible?
threads.message:
I have some 820-2877-B boards to repair and a 820-2361-A DC in jack.

Are the compatible? The connectors are physically compatible, but on eBay if zI search for A1342 (820-2877-B) dcin jacks, I get 820-2627-A.

Is that the only one I can use on these boards?

threads.title: Are Are 820-2877-B and 820-2361-A compatible? and 820-2361-A compatible?
threads.message: If cable length is good, no problem to change them.

threads.title: Are Are 820-2877-B and 820-2361-A compatible? and 820-2361-A compatible?
threads.message: So, 820-2877-B and 820-2361-A  are electronically compatible, correct?

threads.title: Are Are 820-2877-B and 820-2361-A compatible? and 820-2361-A compatible?
threads.message:
All DCIN boards have the same design.
Is very easy to follow traces and draw schematic for few components.

threads.title: Are Are 820-2877-B and 820-2361-A compatible? and 820-2361-A compatible?
